content.question: The encomienda and slavery systems both contributed to which of the following developments?

choices.label: The Spanish colonies developed a social hierarchy based on economic status rather than on racial categories.
The Spanish colonies experienced intermingling between European and Native American populations to such an extent that racial categories ceased to be recognized.
Native Americans, Africans, and Europeans were all integrated into Spanish colonial society on an equal basis.
The Spanish developed a race-based caste system that defined the status of Europeans, Native Americans, Africans, and people of mixed race in their colonies.

content.answer: The Spanish developed a race-based caste system that defined the status of Europeans, Native Americans, Africans, and people of mixed race in their colonies.

topic.text: 1.5: Labor, Slavery, and Caste in the Spanish Colonial System
